de.dfki.lt.mary.unitselection
Class TimelineReader

java.lang.Object
  de.dfki.lt.mary.unitselection.voiceimport.TimelineIO
      de.dfki.lt.mary.unitselection.TimelineReader
Direct Known Subclasses:
LPCTimelineReader, MCepTimelineReader, TimelineTestRoutines
public class TimelineReader
extends TimelineIO

The TimelineReader class provides an interface to read regularly or variably spaced datagrams from a Timeline data file in Mary format.

Author:
sacha

getDatagrams

public Datagram[] getDatagrams(long targetTimeInSamples,
                               long timeSpanInSamples,
                               int reqSampleRate,
                               long[] returnOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Get the datagrams spanning a particular time range from a particular time location, and return the time offset between the time request and the actual location of the first returned datagram.

Parameters:
targetTimeInSamples - the requested position, in samples.
timeSpanInSamples - the requested time span, in samples.
reqSampleRate - the sample rate for the requested and returned times.
returnOffset - the time difference, in samples, between the time request and the actual beginning of the first datagram.
Returns:
an array of datagrams
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getDatagrams

public Datagram[] getDatagrams(Unit unit,
                               int reqSampleRate)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Get the datagrams spanning a particular unit.

Parameters:
unit - The requested speech unit, containing its own position and duration.
reqSampleRate - the sample rate for the requested times, as specified in the "unit space".
Returns:
an array of datagrams
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getDatagrams

public Datagram[] getDatagrams(Unit unit,
                               int reqSampleRate,
                               long[] returnOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Get the datagrams spanning a particular unit, and return the time offset between the unit request and the actual location of the first returned datagram.

Parameters:
unit - The requested speech unit, containing its own position and duration.
reqSampleRate - the sample rate for the requested times, as specified in the "unit space".
returnOffset - the time difference, in samples, between the requested unit and the actual beginning of the first returned datagram.
Returns:
an array of datagrams
Throws:
java.io.IOException
